bill_title: to provide for parental involvement in certain academic activities.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for parental involvement in certain academic activities. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. A school board may require parents or guardians of students enrolled in a school in the district to participate in parental involvement activities as a condition of the student being enrolled in the school. The maximum number of hours of parental involvement activities that may be required is four hours per month. Parental involvement activities are defined as activities directly related to the student's academic progress including parent-teacher conferences, participation on school district committees, and volunteering in classrooms at the student's school. Section 2. If a school board adopts a requirement of parental involvement, an employer shall grant an employee leave to participate in the parental involvement activities that cannot be scheduled during nonwork hours. The employee shall provide reasonable notice of the leave and make a reasonable effort to schedule the leave so as not to unduly disrupt the operations of the employer. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
